## LimitToFrames() function

Limit function calls to browser frames. Useful for animations. Every subsequent call before the next frame is blocked.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function LimitToFrames(): (target: any, propertyKey: import("vue/types/options").InjectKey, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>) => TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>;
```
<b>Returns:</b>

`(target: any, propertyKey: import("vue/types/options").InjectKey, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>) => TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>`

## Remarks

If you want specific time frames, look at [Debounce()](./vue-extra-decorators.debounce.md) or [Debuffer()](./vue-extra-decorators.debuffer.md) instead.

## Example


```TS
  @LimitToFrame()
  render() {
    // Only executed on every frame at max
  }

```
Call limiting decorators: [Debounce()](./vue-extra-decorators.debounce.md) [Debuffer()](./vue-extra-decorators.debuffer.md) [LimitToFrames()](./vue-extra-decorators.limittoframes.md)

Delaying decorators: [Delay()](./vue-extra-decorators.delay.md) [NextFrame()](./vue-extra-decorators.nextframe.md) [NextTick()](./vue-extra-decorators.nexttick.md) [NextMs()](./vue-extra-decorators.nextms.md)

Interval decorators: [Every()](./vue-extra-decorators.every.md) [EveryFrame()](./vue-extra-decorators.everyframe.md)
